tags.title: Admonition
tags.description: A labeled piece of advice, such as a note, tip, warning, etc.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Label
attributes.description: The admonition's label, such as 'Note', 'Tip', 'Warning', etc.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Audio (Sound)
tags.description: An audio stream (sound), such as an .mp3 or .wav file.
tags.examples: [audio title="Bird talk" source=audios/bird_talk.mp3]

attributes.title: Node Caption
attributes.description: An optional caption (small text) associated with the node. The caption is typically displayed below the node.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Audio Source
attributes.description: The relative file path to the audio file. The path is relative to the target HTML file.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Bold Text
tags.examples: This is a [b huge] advantage.

tags.title: Inline Source Code
tags.description: Source code embedded within text.
tags.examples: The assignment [c pi = 3.1415] means we are using [i four] decimals for [c pi].

tags.title: Caption
tags.description: A small title that is not part of he table of contents.
tags.examples: [caption Figure 1: Clove Hitch Knot]

tags.title: Chapter
tags.description: A chapter or sub-chapter of the document. A chapter can have any number of sub-chapters. Chapters can be nested to any level.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

tags.title: Source Code
tags.description: A block of source code.

attributes.title: Use Source Code Syntax Highlighter
attributes.description: Specifies whether the source code should be highlighted or not.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Language
attributes.description: The name of the language used in the source code. This value is used primarily for syntax highlighting. Specify 'auto' to request automatic language detection (works only if this feature is supported by the highlighter). Specify 'text' for simple plain text (without highlighting). To get the list of supported languages please consult the documentation of the syntax highlighter used. Some frequently used values are: c, css, java, javascript, html.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Constant Parameter
tags.description: A constant parameter is used to define text snippets that are re-used several times in the document. A constant parameter is composed of an identifier (name) and a value. The value assigned to the constant can be re-used in the document by simply specifying the constant's identifier between << and >>.
tags.examples:
[const examples_root = http://www.example.com/project/source_code/examples]

Here are two examples:

[link url=<<examples_root>>/ex1.html text=example 1]

[link url=<<examples_root>>/ex2.html text=example 2].

tags.title: Division
tags.description:
A division or section in the document. This node is typically used to render a HTML
...
block with a specific set of HTML attributes.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Document
tags.description: Every PML document must start with a 'document' node. It is the root node of the document.
tags.examples:
[doc title = A Nice Surprise \
    authors = Giovanni Spiridigliotsky \
    date = 2018-11-30

    blah blah blah
]

attributes.title: Document Author(s)
attributes.description: A comma-separated list of authors.

attributes.title: Publication Date
attributes.description: The date the document has been published, in ISO format (yyyy-mm-dd).

attributes.title: Source Code Syntax Highlighter
attributes.description: The name of the syntax highlighter used to highlight source code. Currently supported values are 'highlightjs', 'prism' and 'none'. Default is 'none', which means that source code highlighting is disabled.

attributes.title: Publication Time
attributes.description: The time the document has been published, in ISO format (hh:mm).

attributes.title: TOC Position
attributes.description: The position of the table of contents ('left', 'top', or 'none').

attributes.title: TOC Title
attributes.description: The title of the table of contents.

tags.title: List Element
tags.description: An element of a list.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: HTML Code
tags.description: A node that contains HTML code. The HTML code is not processed in any way by the PML converter. It is passed as is to the resulting HTML document. This allows you to embed arbitrary HTML code in your final document.
tags.examples:
[html

This is pure HTML code.

html]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Italic Text
tags.examples:
We want [i simplicity].

This is a [b [i very] important] point.

tags.title: Image
tags.description:
An image, such as a .jpg or .png file.
Note about the HTML 'alt' tag:
Attribute 'html_alt' can be used to add an explicit 'alt' attribute in the resulting HTML (see example).
If no explicit 'html_alt' is provided then the value of the 'title' attribute is used for the 'alt' attribute.
If no 'title' attribute is provided then the value of the 'caption' attribute is used.
tags.examples:
[image source = images/strawberries.jpg \
    title = Strawberries (Photo by Jacek Dylag on Unsplash) \
    link = https://unsplash.com/photos/kH3Sr9K8EBA \
    html_alt = Delicious strawberries]

attributes.title: Horizontal Alignment
attributes.description: The horizontal alignment of the picture. Valid values are: left, center, and right.

attributes.title: Border
attributes.description: This parameter can be set to 'yes' to draw a border around the image.

attributes.title: Node Caption
attributes.description: An optional caption (small text) associated with the node. The caption is typically displayed below the node.

attributes.title: Image Height
attributes.description: The height of the image, expressed in pixels.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: URL link
attributes.description: An URL link to the image. If the user clicks on the image, the browser will head to the specified URL.

attributes.title: Image Source
attributes.description: The relative file path to the image file. The path is relative to the target HTML file.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

attributes.title: Image Width
attributes.description: The width of the image, expressed in pixels.

tags.title: Input
tags.description: Any input provided to a software application, such as a command typed in a terminal, text contained in a config file, etc.
tags.examples:
[input
    pmlc create_reference_manual -output_directory path/to/dir
input]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Insert File
tags.description: Insert a .pml file in the current document. The text contained in the file is inserted at the position of the 'insert' node. This is useful to split a big document into several files (e.g. each chapter is contained in a different file), or to re-use text snippets that appear in several documents.
tags.examples:
[doc title=A Strange Trip
    [insert file=chapters/introduction.pml]
    [insert file=chapters/story.pml]
    [insert file=chapters/conclusion.pml]
]

attributes.title: File
attributes.description: Absolute or relative path to the file to be inserted. In case of a relative path, it is relative to the directory of the PML file in which the [c insert] is defined.

tags.title: Insert Source Code
tags.description: Insert source code stored in an external file.
tags.examples: [insert_code file=resources/ref_manual/resources/source_code/hello_world.ppl]

attributes.title: File
attributes.description: Absolute or relative path to the source code file. In case of a relative path, it is relative to the working directory at the time of running the PML converter.

attributes.title: Insert From Regex
attributes.description:
If this parameter is not defined (set to null by default) then the source code inserted into the document starts at the beginning of the file content. A regular expression can be assigned to this parameter. In that case the source code inserted into the document starts at the first match of the regular expression in the source code file.

If parameter 'include_from_regex' is set to 'yes' (default value), then the string that matches the regex is included in the document's source code. If parameter 'include_from_regex' is set to 'no' then the string that matches the regex is not included in the document's source code.
attributes.examples:
from_regex = "function foo ( name string )"
from_regex = "// start insert.*\r?\n" include_from_regex = no

attributes.title: Use Source Code Syntax Highlighter
attributes.description: Specifies whether the source code should be highlighted or not.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Include From Regex
attributes.description: Please refer to the description of parameter 'from_regex' for an explanation of this parameter

attributes.title: Include To Regex
attributes.description: Please refer to the description of parameter 'to_regex' for an explanation of this parameter

attributes.title: Language
attributes.description: The name of the language used in the source code. This value is used primarily for syntax highlighting. Specify 'auto' to request automatic language detection (works only if this feature is supported by the highlighter). Specify 'text' for simple plain text (without highlighting). To get the list of supported languages please consult the documentation of the syntax highlighter used. Some frequently used values are: c, css, java, javascript, html.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

attributes.title: Insert To Regex
attributes.description:
If this parameter is not defined (set to null by default) then the source code inserted into the document ends at the end of the file content. A regular expression can be assigned to this parameter. In that case the source code inserted into the document ends at the first match of the regular expression in the source code file. If parameter 'from_regex' is also defined, then the search for this regex starts after the match of 'from_regex'.

If parameter 'include_to_regex' is set to 'yes' (default value), then the string that matches the regex is included in the document's source code. If parameter 'include_to_regex' is set to 'no' then the string that matches the regex is not included in the document's source code.
attributes.examples:
to_regex = "\}\r?\n"
to_regex = "\s*// end insert" include_to_regex = no

tags.title: URL Link
tags.description: A URL link to a resource, such as a website or a file to download.
tags.examples: Please have a look at [link url=http://www.example.com/articles/123 text=this article] for more information.

attributes.title: URL text
attributes.description: The text to be displayed instead of the URL. If no text is specified then the URL itself is displayed.

attributes.title: URL
attributes.description: The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) of the link.

tags.title: List
tags.description: A bulleted list of text blocks.
tags.examples:
[list
    [el item 1]
    [el item 2]
]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Monospace
tags.description:
A paragraph in which whitespace is preserved, and a fixed-width font is used. The text will be rendered exactly as written in the PML document.
The following rules apply to the text in a 'monospace' block:
- The width of each character (letter, digit, symbol) is the same.
- All spaces and line-breaks in the text are preserved and rendered in the final document.
Inline nodes can be used within a 'monospace' block. Hence standard character escape rules are applied.
tags.examples:
[monospace title = "A Pascal Triangle"
      1
    1   1
  1   2   1
1   3   3   1
]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: New Line
tags.description: An explicit new line (line break) inserted in the document.
tags.examples: Line 1[nl][nl]Line 2

tags.title: Note
tags.description: A note is an admonition whose label is 'Note'.
tags.examples: [note Please remember that ...]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Output
tags.description: Any output created by a software application, such as a result written to the OS's standard output device.
tags.examples:
[output
    Congratulations!
    The new database has been created successfully.
output]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Paragraph
tags.description: A paragraph is a set of one or more sentences. Note that it is not required to embed a paragraph within a node. Text not explicitly embedded in a node is automatically converted to a paragraph node. A double-new-line creates a paragraph break. All other whitespace is converted to a single space. Hence, two sentences separated by a single new-line will result in a single paragraph composed of two sentences.
tags.examples:
First sentence of first paragraph. Second sentence of first paragraph.

First sentence of second paragraph.
Second sentence of second paragraph.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.

[p Third paragraph]

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Quote
tags.description: A piece of text said or written by somebody else.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Source of Quote
attributes.description: The source of the quote, such as the name of a person, the title of an article, etc.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Space Character
tags.description: An explicit space character inserted in the document. Whitespace composed of several characters (such as two spaces) is always converted into a single space (as in HTML). Hence, this node can be used to explicitly insert two or more spaces.
tags.examples:
This is  g  o  o  d !  [-- 2 spaces will result in ONE space --]

This is [sp]g[sp][sp]o[sp][sp]o[sp][sp]d[sp]!

tags.title: Span
tags.description: This inline node is typically used to render a HTML ... inline element with a specific set of HTML attributes.
tags.examples: This is a [span html_style="color:red;background-color:yellow" huge] advantage.

tags.title: Table
tags.description:
A table consisting of rows and columns.
The content of each cell can be just plain text or any complex node, such as formatted text, a picture, a table (table in a table), etc.
The table's structure is similar to a HTML table.
HTML 'class' and 'style' attributes can be use to format the table with CSS.
The table can optionally have a header and a footer.
tags.examples:
Simple table:

[table
    [tr [tc C11] [tc C12]]
    [tr [tc C21] [tc C22]]
]

Table with header and footer:

[table
    [theader
        [tr [tc Pos.] [tc Group] [tc Total invoiced]]
    ]
    [tr [tc 1] [tc [i Organic] food] [tc html_style="text-align:right;" 12,000.22]]
    [tr [tc 2] [tc Meditation lessons] [tc html_style="text-align:right;" 21,350.00]]
    [tfooter
        [tr [tc] [tc html_style="text-align:right;" Sum:] [tc html_style="text-align:right;" 33,350.22]]
    ]
]

attributes.title: Node Caption
attributes.description: An optional caption (small text) associated with the node. The caption is typically displayed below the node.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Table Data
tags.description:
Simple table data defined as plain text, and rendered as a table.
Each line of text represents a row.
Cell values in a row are separated by a comma or a TAB character.
The content of each cell can only be plain text. If formatted text or complex cell content (e.g. picture in a cell, or table in a table) is needed, then please use the 'table' tag.
A header and footer can optionally be defined.
The horizontal alignment (left, center, or right) can be specified for each column.
The data will be rendered as a table.
The following format rules apply:
- Rows are separated by a line break. Empty lines are ignored.
- Cells can be separated by a comma or a TAB character, but both separators cannot be mixed in a table.
- Spaces before or after cell values are ignored.
- If the second line is a dash (-) then the first line is a header.
- If the second-last line is a dash (-) then the last line is a footer.
tags.examples:
Simple table:

[table_data
    cell 1.1, cell 1.2
    cell 2.1, cell 2.2
table_data]

[table_data halign="C,L,R" title="Table with header, footer, and column alignments"
    Position, Product, Price
    -
    1, Organic food, 12.50
    2, Meditation lessons, 150.00
    -
    ,,Total: 162.50
table_data]

attributes.title: Horizontal Alignments for Columns
attributes.description:
This optional parameter specifies the horizontal alignment for each column in a table.
The alignments are defined as a comma-separated list, in the order of the columns.
For each column the following values can be specified:
- left or l
- center or c
- right or r
- {empty} (default alignment (usually left-aligned) will be used)
The values are case-insensitive. Uppercase letters are allowed.
attributes.examples:
halign = "Left, Center, , Right"
short from:
halign = "L, C, , R"

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

tags.title: Table Cell
tags.description: A cell in a table row.
tags.examples:
Table with 2 rows and 3 columns:

[table
    [tr [tc cell 1.1] [tc cell 1.2] [tc cell 1.3]]
    [tr [tc cell 2.1] [tc cell 2.2] [tc cell 2.3]]
]

tags.title: Text
tags.examples: It's a good day.

tags.title: Table Footer
tags.description: A footer in a table.
tags.examples:
Table with footer:

[table
    [tr [tc cell 1.1] [tc cell 1.2] [tc cell 1.3]]
    [tr [tc cell 2.1] [tc cell 2.2] [tc cell 2.3]]
    [tfooter
        [tr [tc Footer 1] [tc Footer 2] [tc Footer 3]]
    ]
]

tags.title: Table Header
tags.description: A header in a table.
tags.examples:
Table with header:

[table
    [theader
        [tr [tc Header 1] [tc Header 2] [tc Header 3]]
    ]
    [tr [tc cell 1.1] [tc cell 1.2] [tc cell 1.3]]
    [tr [tc cell 2.1] [tc cell 2.2] [tc cell 2.3]]
]

tags.title: Table Row
tags.description: A row in a table.
tags.examples:
Table with 2 rows:

[table
    [tr [tc cell 1.1] [tc cell 1.2] [tc cell 1.3]]
    [tr [tc cell 2.1] [tc cell 2.2] [tc row 2.3]]
]

tags.title: Verbatim Text
tags.examples: Math's ring operator is [verbatim ∘].

tags.title: Video
tags.description: A video, such as an .mp4 or .webm file.
tags.examples: [video source = videos/red_flower.mp4 title = Beautiful Nature]

attributes.title: Node Caption
attributes.description: An optional caption (small text) associated with the node. The caption is typically displayed below the node.

attributes.title: Video Height
attributes.description: The height of the video, expressed in pixels.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Video Source
attributes.description: The relative file path to the video file. The path is relative to the target HTML file.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

attributes.title: Video Width
attributes.description: The width of the video, expressed in pixels.

tags.title: Cross-Reference
tags.description: A cross-reference (link) to another node in the same document.

attributes.title: Node Id
attributes.description: The identifier of the target node that is referenced.

attributes.title: Text
attributes.description: The text to be displayed for the cross-reference. If this attribute is omitted, then the title of the target node is displayed. If the target node doesn't have a title, then the target node's identifier is displayed instead.

tags.title: Embedded Youtube Video
tags.description: A Youtube video embedded in the document.
tags.examples:
[youtube_video yid = qrcZqnICYbs \
    title = Hellzapoppin 1941 - Enjoy! \
    width = 600 \
    height = 400]

attributes.title: Node Caption
attributes.description: An optional caption (small text) associated with the node. The caption is typically displayed below the node.

attributes.title: Video Height
attributes.description: The height of the video, expressed in pixels.

attributes.title: Node Identifier
attributes.description:
A unique identifier for the node. The id can be used for cross-referencing, or for local links in the resulting HTML code.
An identifier must start with a letter and can be followed by any number of letters, digits, and underscores. Note for programmers: The regex of an identifier is: [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_]*. Identifiers are case-sensitive. The following identifiers are all different: name, Name, and NAME.

attributes.title: Node Title
attributes.description: An optional small title, typically displayed above the node.

attributes.title: Video Width
attributes.description: The width of the video, expressed in pixels.

attributes.title: Youtube Video Id
attributes.description: The identifier of the Youtube video. This identifier is displayed in the video's URL on Youtube. Example: If the URL of the Youtube video is https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NUDhA4hXdS8 then the identifier is NUDhA4hXdS8.
